definition: to be sleepless all night
thorough/penetrating/to pervade/to pass through
night
(negative prefix)/not/no
to sleep/to hibernate

sentences.english: The mother sat up all night with the sick child.
sentences.chinese: 母親徹夜不眠守候着那生病的孩子。

sentences.english: With so much work to do, we had to stay up through the whole night.
sentences.chinese: 有這麼多工作要做，我們只得徹夜不眠。

sentences.english: They sometimes stay up all night.
He lay awake all night, thinking about his new job.
sentences.chinese: 他徹夜不眠，想着他的新工作。

sentences.english: He was pale with fatigue after his sleepless night.
sentences.chinese: 他徹夜不眠，疲倦得臉色蒼白。

sentences.english: We used to stay up all night, drinking wine and arguing heatedly about politics.
sentences.chinese: 我們常常徹夜不眠，一邊喝酒，一邊熱烈地談論政治。

sentences.english: They do not lie awake in the dark and weep for their sins.
sentences.chinese: 不會躺在黑暗中徹夜不眠，爲自己的罪孽流淚。

sentences.english: TOBEY-M:Something you said kept me up all night.
sentences.chinese: 你說的一些話，讓我徹夜不眠。

sentences.english: He plodded away all night at the accounts but didn't finish them in time.
sentences.chinese: 他徹夜不眠地清理賬目，卻未能按時完成。

sentences.english: We will but laugh into thy lidless eyes?
sentences.chinese: 我們只是對着你徹夜不眠的眼睛訕笑？

definition: false alarm/panic rumor/CL:場|场[chang2]
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
reluctant to part
the person who shares your bed/partner/spouse
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
red in the face/extremely angry
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
the Smurfs/Smurf
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to ride the dragon/to die (of emperors and kings)
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
(Tw) (slang) to pass time idly/to chill/to hang out
sullen/to scowl miserably
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
fig. romantic relationship between an elderly couple/falling in love in the autumn of one's life
the second person/(fig.) someone else/third party
